name: Past Experience
description: This is a description of the past experience

grammar.name: Past Simple
grammar.description: Use the past simple tense for completed actions in the past. This is the most common tense for describing past experiences.

grammar.name: Past Continuous
grammar.description: Use the past continuous tense for actions that were in progress at a specific time in the past.

grammar.name: Past Perfect
grammar.description: Use the past perfect tense for actions that were completed before another action in the past.
examples: I had finished my homework before dinner.
She had already left when I arrived.
We had already eaten when the movie started.

grammar.name: Past Perfect Continuous
grammar.description: Use the past perfect continuous tense for actions that were in progress before another action in the past.

rules.negative: subject + had not + been + verb + ing
rules.question: had + subject + been + verb + ing

examples: I had been studying for two hours when she called.
She had been working all day when I saw her.
We had been waiting for an hour when the bus arrived.

grammar.name: Used to
grammar.description: Use 'used to' to describe past habits or states that are no longer true.

rules.negative: subject + did not + use to + verb
rules.question: did + subject + use to + verb

examples: I used to play the piano.
She used to live in New York.
We used to go to the beach every summer.

grammar.name: Would
grammar.description: Use 'would' to describe past habits or states that are no longer true.
examples: She would live in New York.
We would go to the beach every summer.

vocabulary.name: Verbs
vocabulary.description: These are some common verbs used to describe past experiences.
